sent1: Armistice Day in Britain is usually a solemn moment of reflection , but this year’s atmosphere feels notably different .
sent2: In Britain , Armistice Day is known as Remembrance Day . The red poppy is worn to remember those who died in the two world wars and subsequent conflicts . This year , the remembrance of those who gave their lives for their country has become a focal point for the debate over the nature of Britishness . In the 2016 referendum on Brexit , the majority of voters in England and Wales voted to leave the European Union , while majorities in Scotland and Northern Ireland voted to remain . Now , some pro - EU Scots are refusing to wear the traditional poppies as an act of defiance against Brexiteers whom they accuse of hijacking British patriotism . sent1: Israel 's Supreme Court rejected a right - wing petition demanding its rulings bind the government , upholding judicial independence .
sent2: Israel’s Supreme Court rejected an attempt by the country’s legislature to limit its power , including on matters of religion and state . The court struck down a law passed last year that would have allowed the Knesset to override decisions by the court with a simple majority vote . " The Basic Law is intended to harm the status and standing of this court , ” Justice Hanan Melcer wrote in the ruling . " It is meant to ‘cut off the branch’ on which it sits . ” He said the court would not be able to fulfill its role as protector of civil rights if it were subjected to such political control . The decision was hailed by religious pluralism advocates , who had feared the legislation could be used to block their efforts to gain equal recognition under Israeli law .

Through an ethnographic study of the catechism , I will explore how Goans make sense of their place in Kenyan society through a complex negotiation of religion , ethnicity and nationality . The law cannot justify because it only reveals sin but cannot remove it . Only Christ can do that . When you see your sin , run to Jesus . He is the one who takes away the sins of the world .

sent1: In the 1970 s , the U.S. mandated shellfish testing for PSP , a deadly neurotoxin causing paralysis and death in humans .

The cancer has since been found to have infected many types of marine life worldwide , including sea urchins , mussels and lobsters . A new study suggests it 's been around for at least a century or two . ...
